item.title: MathWorks, Creator of MATLAB, Confirms Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Kristina Beeks reports: MathWorks, a mathematical computing software company headquartered in Natick, Mass., disclosed a ransomware attack in an update to its website on Monday. MathWorks is known for creating the MATLAB computing platform and the Simulink simulation, which is used by thousands of organizations and customers. “The attack affected our IT systems. Some of...

item.title: Russian hospital programmer gets 14 years for leaking soldier data to Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Daryna Antoniuk reports: A Russian court sentenced a former hospital programmer to 14 years in a high-security penal colony for allegedly leaking personal data of Russian soldiers to Ukraine, authorities said. The court in the Russian Irkutsk region found 37-year-old Alexander Levchishin guilty of treason after he copied electronic medical records of Russian military personnel from...

item.title: MSCS board renews contract with PowerSchool while suing them
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Brian Didlake reports: Memphis-Shelby County Schools board members approved a multi-million dollar contract to continue doing business with a company they’re suing in court. The school board announced it was filing a lawsuit against PowerSchool earlier this month after thousands of students’ personal information was leaked. Now, board members said that was in the past...

item.title: Iranian Man Pleaded Guilty to Role in Robbinhood Ransomware
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: From the U.S. Department of Justice: An Iranian national pleaded guilty today to participating in an international ransomware and extortion scheme involving the Robbinhood ransomware. According to court documents and statements made in court, Sina Gholinejad, 37, and his co-conspirators compromised the computer networks of cities, corporations, health care organizations, and other entities around the United...

item.title: Developments surrounding data breach at Dutch police
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: From a press release at politie.nl: The intelligence services AIVD and MIVD announced today that a previously unknown Russian cyber group has carried out hacks on various Dutch organisations, including the police in September 2024. This fits in with the findings of the investigation that the High Tech Crime Team started immediately after the hack,...

item.title: Estonia launches international search for Moroccan citizen wanted over data theft
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: ERR reports: The Central Criminal Police and the Office of the Prosecutor General have initiated an international search for a Moroccan citizen suspected of last year unlawfully accessing and downloading data from a customer card system managed by Allium UPI. Allium UPI is the parent company of the Apotheka pharmacy chain. Based on evidence collected...

item.title: Now it’s Tiffany: Another LVMH luxury brand hit by hackers
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: First it was Dior. Now it’s Tiffany & Co. Seok Nam-jun and Kim Mi-geon report: Tiffany & Co. has confirmed a data breach affecting customers in South Korea, marking the second such incident involving an LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton brand after a similar case at Dior. On May 26, Tiffany Korea notified select customers...

item.title: Dutch Government: More forms of espionage to be a criminal offence from 15 May onwards
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: From the Government of the Netherlands: More forms of espionage, such as digital and diaspora espionage, are to be a criminal offence from 15 May onwards. To achieve this a new criminal provision is being added to the Dutch Criminal Code. The government wants the law to protect national security, public safety, critical infrastructure and...

item.title: B.C. health authority faces class-action lawsuit over 2009 data breach (1)
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Brendan Shykora reports: B.C.’s Interior Health Authority (IH) has been served a class-action lawsuit over a data breach in 2009 that allegedly exposed thousands of employees’ sensitive information, which ended up sold on the dark web. Filed in B.C. Supreme Court Thursday, May 22, the lawsuit claims the breach compromised the personal information of employees who worked for IH between...

item.title: Private Industry Notification: Silent Ransom Group Targeting Law Firms
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: The following information is being provided by the FBI, with no guarantees or warranties, for potential use at the sole discretion of recipients to protect against cyber threats. This data is provided to help cyber security professionals and system administrators guard against the persistent malicious actions of cyber actors. This PIN was coordinated with DHS/CISA. ...
